word:
Melrose, Mass., August 30, 1904: I thank my heavenly Father that I have slept more than for several nights. I thank the Lord that my faculties are preserved. God is the Lord and greatly to be praised. I shall speak today and on the morrow in this place. May the Lord bless and sanctify me and make me strong to do His will. I ask for health that I may 


                                     -422- 

use the powers He has given me to His name's glory.
